page.title: 15Forestry
page.content: The Forestry Commission plantation at Gallows Hill consists of 29 hectares of coniferous woodland, 20 hectares of which were planted with Corsican Pine in l96l. The other 9 hectares were planted with Bishop Pine in l983 following devastation by fire. Both crops will be thinned at 25, 30, 35 and 40 years, and final felling will occur at year 50. By that time each hectare will have produced approximately 700 cubic metres of utilisable timber at an approximate value of Â£8,000 per hectare. After clear felling the area will be deep ploughed and replanted, so starting the next rotation.
